block.p: The five most e-mailed articles from nytimes.com/sports for April 14 to 20. 1. A MEASURE OF RESPECT FOR JACKIE ROBINSON TURNS INTO A MOVEMENT Major leaguers wear No. 42 on the 60th anniversary of Robinson's debut. (Published April 13) 2. NASCAR AT CROSSROADS AFTER YEARS OF GROWTH A remarkable rise, then a plateau. (April 15) 3. HORSES' VICTORIES GARNER ATTENTION, BUT ALSO RAISE SOME QUESTIONS Quality of the competition and race surfaces vary. (April 16) 3. THE SHORT AND HAPPY CAREER OF RON WRIGHT One major league game, three at-bats, six outs. (April 15) 5. MORE THAN A HANDSHAKE DEAL FOR JAPANESE BASEBALL PLAYERS ''Fight money'' is a common reward. (April 17)
